titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The weather continues to be disconcertingly warm & damp, very unhelpful to work. Beyond writing a number of letters, and making a bad start at the Temple Sermon, I did little. For exercise I sawed wood, and walked with Ernest.
